actions.committee: House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs.

official_title: A bill to provide for a comprehensive 5-year study of the nuclear fuel cycle, with particular reference to its safety and environmental hazards, to be conducted by the Office of Technological Assessment.

summary.text: Nuclear Energy Study Act - Directs the Office of Technology Assessment to undertake an independent comprehensive study of the nuclear fuel cycle. Requires all government agencies to cooperate to the fullest extent with the Office. Requires the Office to provide annual reports to Congress and the public on the progress of the study. Directs the Office to submit a final report to the Congress and the public five years after the enactment of this Act concerning the safety and environmental hazards of nuclear fission power plants and the nuclear fuel cycle. Authorizes the appropriation of $2,000,000 for each of the first five fiscal years beginning after the date of the enactment of this Act to fund the study.

titles.title: A bill to provide for a comprehensive 5-year study of the nuclear fuel cycle, with particular reference to its safety and environmental hazards, to be conducted by the Office of Technological Assessment.
